newsitem.title: POLAND: Merrill sees NFI units at PLN 151-243.
newsitem.headline: Merrill sees NFI units at PLN 151-243.

text.p: Merrill Lynch in London said in a report dated March 17 that the Polish mass privatisation NFI units should trade at between 151 and 243 zlotys.
It also said Polish National Investment Funds (NFI), likely to start bourse trade, should appeal both to emerging European investors and close-end fund investors.
"We believe that the current price of the (NFI unit) offers significant upside, and implies similar potential for (NFI) share price appreciation, following the anticipated summer listing," it said.
NFI units traded at 156.5 zlotys on Tuesday and at 166 zlotys on the day the report was issued.
The report stressed, however, that each NFI represented different value because of its sector emphasis, approach to restructuring and fund objective.
"Accordingly we believe careful stocks selection is of vital importance to NFI investors," it said.
Under the government's NFI programme, shares in some 500 mid-sized companies are allocated to 15 NFIs run by foreign and domestic management firms.
The 26 million Poles who bought a participation unit in the scheme will have the opportunity to exchange it for 15 shares, one in each fund before they start bourse trade.
